bwwExcerpt: Even so, the reason to return to The Geffen Playhouse's production must be Flockhart, whose snarling, cackling and weeping Martha fuels the play's churning engine. While Quinto certainly presents a menacing George - one believably wonders in later acts if he'll return to the stage with a gun loaded with bullets instead of an umbrella - Flockhart's poison tongue and plaintive tears fully crystallize the terror of the marriage.
